title: Windows 10 Game Mode makes client really slow
body:
So whenever I use Game Mode on Windows 10 the client becomes really sluggish.

First of all, I don't know why the game bar pops up when you click windows + g as if its a game, but that makes no sense.

The expected behavior is for the client to not be affected by game mode...

replies.body:
Gamemode/gamebar has been a trashfire since release, standard procedure is uninstalling as much of it as possible and disabling the rest.

It is not a problem with individual games, just microsoft and invasive overlays.

> [{quoted}](name=MagicFlyingLlama,realm=NA,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=TXgaMBHM,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-08-09T02:33:59.616+0000)
>
> Gamemode/gamebar has been a trashfire since release, standard procedure is uninstalling as much of it as possible and disabling the rest.
> 
> It is not a problem with individual games, just microsoft and invasive overlays.

I have really no problems with it in any other games. It has been useful for me when I watch twitch/netflix on my other monitor to avoid stuttering.

It typically causes stuttering, there is utterly no reason it would prevent it, though.

That sounds like bad hardware acceleration configuration, honestly. Disable it in stuff like discord or your browser if you do not have resources to spare.

> [{quoted}](name=MagicFlyingLlama,realm=NA,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=TXgaMBHM,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2018-08-09T03:24:05.114+0000)
>
> It typically causes stuttering, there is utterly no reason it would prevent it, though.
> 
> That sounds like bad hardware acceleration configuration, honestly. Disable it in stuff like discord or your browser if you do not have resources to spare.

I have more than enough to spare with a gtx1060 and 4770k. There are reasons why it would prevent it... It prioritizes CPU and GPU resources to the game. So even if Netflix or twitch is running in the background, it doesn't affect my games. Yes, disabling hardware acceleration works for Twitch, but that is not an option for CPU intensive games.

Game Mode never bothered me one bit except when it comes to the LoL client. For most people, it will do absolutely nothing. For me, it helps because i run stuff in the background all the time.

It should not needs to prioritize anything, those can handle hardware acceleration while playing without any issues.

Software is screwed up, fix the cause instead of the symptom.
